pros: Everyone I work with is talented, down-to-earth, and fun to be around. They know their stuff, but they don’t take themselves too seriously. It makes for a really great work atmosphere that I genuinely enjoy.
cons: Too little communication from the top down.

job_title: Registered Medical Assistant in Merrillville, IN
pros: The nurse practitioners I worked with were wonderful
cons: Everything. Pay is terrible. Managers micromanage. Schedule sucks

review_title: My Experience at NorthShore Health Centers
pros:
Pay & benefits
My salary here was unbelievable. Honestly, it was my time here that taught me my own value and what I should be expecting/demanding from my employers. The benefits were good too, but everything paled in comparison to how much I was getting paid by the time I put in my two weeks. 

Job security 
As far as job security goes, I never heard of or saw anyone get let go who we didn’t all see it coming. When someone got fired, it made sense. They were clearly problematic and no amount of speaking with them or trying to work things out together ever worked. The company definitely never let go of someone who deserved to stay. 

Management
The managers I worked with on a close basis were fantastic. They treated everyone with kindness and respect and didn’t have massive egos that they expected everyone else to cater to.

Overall
It was an incredible experience and one I don’t take lightly. While I did eventually decide to leave, it wasn’t an easy decision and I still have some lingering regrets and thoughts of “what if”. But I’m happy with the time I spent here and everything I learned and how much I grew, both as a person and in my career. It was extremely beneficial and I’m glad I got the opportunity to work here.
cons: I wish there had been more opportunities to move up in the direction I wanted to go when I was there. If there had been, I probably wouldn’t have left.

pros: - Treated like a family - Busy work day
cons: - Compensation is minimal - Have to wake up early

review_title: Someone needs to get their egos in check

cons: Some staff, administration in particular, don't seem to think of the patients at all and even less of the employees. Personally I have witnessed the current CEO yelling at a staff member inappropriately while within earshot of patients. This was embarrassing to me. I hope the administration staff gets their egos in check before we lose valuable staff and patients.

job_title: Revenue Cycle Specialist in Portage, IN

review_title: If I could do more than 5 stars, I would!
pros:
My manager is amazing! Not only is she incredibly helpful and intelligent, but I am treated with respect and as an asset to the team. The training program is very helpful — you’ll start here feeling confident. 

This is a very team-oriented environment. You are constantly communicating between departments throughout the entire organization to reach the same goals (to help patients). I love how everyone is so friendly, helpful to one another, and eager to help out with whatever issues we’re dealing with. People like this really make the workday enjoyable. I love it here, and I’m not leaving!
cons: At least when working at the front desk, if you’re not fast-paced, articulate, a good problem solver, and communicative, you might not do well. This is a fast, deadline driven role. However, there’s no better feeling that getting into the flow of working here and feeling accomplished at the end of the day. We’re supported with a great PTO policy - but I don’t ever like time off! I love it too much!

pros: Love the clients and the team I work with.

job_title: Family Nurse Practitioner in Portage, IN
pros: The reason this is the most challenging job I ever had is because it requires reexamination of assumptions and notions of best practices I had accumulated over 15 years of my career. Everything is being challenged on intellectual level, and I have to be always on my toes. But this is also fun because we are working towards something that genuinely matters and improves people’s lives.
cons: A part of NSHC culture is its own language or mode of communications among people which is so unique that you feel lost the first several weeks of working here. It gets easier after that, but it can still take a while to adjust.

pros: Almost everything about working here was a pro. Working here was one of the best decisions I’ve made in my career. The people I met and the skills I learned are serving me well in my life after NorthShore. I wish the company and everyone who works here the best of luck!
cons: Management has very specific ideas about how things should be done. Everyone can share their ideas, but at the end of the day they have the final say. If you agree, great. If not, realize that there’s a way to leave amicably and on good terms. No point in burning bridges, especially not at such a good company.

pros: It's a paycheck I guess

review_title: I would do it all over again
pros: I learned a lot while working here. Not just from my manager, but also from my fellow coworkers. It was a good use of my time for almost 4 years, and even though I left, I’m grateful for the experience and would do it all over again given the chance.
cons: There aren’t very many cons. Other than it being difficult to find a decent work/life balance, nothing really comes to mind. I know on sites like this that can sound fake, but I genuinely can’t think of anything to complain about. Overall, it’s just a really good company to work for and I’m glad I did.

review_title: Easily the best place I’ve worked
pros: The center has an amazing culture and everyone was a pleasure to work with! It’s a very open and welcoming environment with a great team mindset. In addition, the company is big on work-life balance (rare in the healthcare industry) which is a huge plus. I’ve never worked in a more supportive environment. Benefits, 401K, and great people! It’s a win-win situation.
cons: It’s healthcare, not all of the people you treat are nice.

pros: The center has set systems and processes in place that are extremely straight forward and easy to follow. If you just follow these it’s almost impossible to be bad at your job.
cons: Sometimes patients take their own issues out on you. You need a lot of patience and a very level-head to do this job.

pros:
*Excellent work atmosphere
*Great PTO policy 
*Best manager ever! Thoughtful, smart, and kind
*Ethical, value-driven company
*Great support teams (IT, HR, etc.) 
*Very organized and clear communication
*Continuous opportunities to be the best at your job that you can be
cons: It can get very busy at times, like a lot of health care centers. But it’s a sign that we’re doing a good job and helping a lot of people! It brings a level of job security, too.
